page.title: 11THE COOKLEY POPULATION
page.content: The village is an interesting mix of people. It was originally a small farming community which was superceeded by the industrial development of the {iron works}.Many of the oldest families in the village derive from workers brought in to service this industry. As the steel works and the canal declined in importance, carpet weavers from kidderminster settled and commuted to work. Lately there has been some settlement of people who use the village as a dormitory, commuting to work in the West Midland connurbation. It is interesting that each succeeding type are regarded as 'foreigners' by the residents, often for many years.
